page.title: 20Contributors
page.content: The Domesday Survey was undertaken by two schools in Gnosall. Class 8 of {St. Lawrence First School} undertook a great deal of work in the local area. They did a survey of the shops, talked to local farmers, the vicar and the Methodist minister and walked along the Shropshire Union Canal. They also wrote about their interests and hobbies. Mrs. Butlin, teacher of Class 8 collated their work. Also taking part were pupils of {Heron Brook Middle School}. Pupils in 4L went out on several occasions to complete the land cover and amenity counts. Together with pupils in 2-1, they also interviewed several leading members of the local community. Thanks to all for their lively and interesting contributions. Mr. and Mrs. B. Oldbury took the photographs.
